Titulo: A computational study of the effect of alloying additions on the stability of Ni/c-ZrO2 interfaces

Sentencas: In this work, we investigate the effect of 9 alloying additions (Ag, Au, Cd, Co, Cu, Fe, Sn, Sb, and V) on the stability of Ni/c-ZrO2 interfaces.
Titulo: A computational study of the effect of alloying additions on the stability of Ni/c-ZrO2 interfaces

Sentencas: We provide an analysis of the impact of oxygen partial pressure on segregation/desegregation behavior of the dopants.
Titulo: A computational study of the effect of alloying additions on the stability of Ni/c-ZrO2 interfaces

Sentencas: Based on the performed calculations, we show that addition of Co, Fe, or V to the classical SOFC anode can improve its stability under typical SOFC operating conditions.
Titulo: A computational study of the effect of alloying additions on the stability of Ni/c-ZrO2 interfaces

Sentencas: We also predict that Ag, Au, Cd, Cu, Sn, and Sb alloying additions might increase the agglomeration rate of the metal particles.
Titulo: A computational study of the effect of alloying additions on the stability of Ni/c-ZrO2 interfaces

Sentencas: Nevertheless, at low doping concentrations and high anode porosity the negative effect might be minimized by segregation of alloying additions at a Ni surface.
Titulo: A computational study of the effect of alloying additions on the stability of Ni/c-ZrO2 interfaces

Sentencas: Predicted results are of significant interest for the design of bimetallic cermet for SOFC anode materials.
